meanings.definition: Crunks (noun): plural form of crunk, a style of hip-hop music
meanings.sent1: The club was filled with the energetic sounds of crunks.
meanings.sent2: I love listening to crunks while I work out.
meanings.sent3: The party really started to pick up once the crunks started playing.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were like crunks, full of energy and rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The crunks blared through the speakers, making everyone want to dance.

meanings.definition: Crunks (verb): third person singular present of crunk, to get excited or hyped up
meanings.sent1: She crunks whenever she hears her favorite song.
meanings.sent2: The crowd crunks as the band takes the stage.
meanings.sent3: I can't help but crunks when I see puppies playing.
meanings.sent4: His heart crunks with joy when he sees his family.
meanings.sent5: The children crunks with laughter at the silly clown.

meanings.definition: Crunks (adjective): comparative form of crunk, more excited or hyped up
meanings.sent1: The party was even more crunks than I expected.
meanings.sent2: She had a crunks expression on her face when she won the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked crunks as it chased after the laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: The city was crunks with anticipation for the big event.
meanings.sent5: His eyes sparkled with a crunks excitement as he opened the gift.
